description.narrative: National and sub-national education systems have strengthened capacity for the delivery of quality and inclusive education, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized, are provided with inclusive and equitable quality education, developmental and learning opportunities in safe and secure learning environments

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and sub-national education systems have strengthened capacity for the delivery of quality and inclusive education

description.narrative: A key development challenge is the high number of children who do not learn to read for meaning in the early years of school. UNICEF efforts have focused on providing technical support to DBE to improve reading outcomes in the Home Language and English as a First Additional Language amongst Foundation Phase learners. Key results include improvement in Grade 12 pass rates, improvement in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) pass rates; and scale-up of the early grade reading study to 300 schools in North West province and development of the coaching programme for improved cost-effectiveness and sustainability. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2020
